concept.title: Adding a Node to a Cluster

section.p: ### DRAFT version ### - to be completed - take into account Bug 9591:

Build: BES-MAIN-DAILY-3056 (2012/08/28) Version: BES 15.2 sprint_D Test category: installation (cluster model) OS:Winodws server 2008 We have already finished installation of node 1 in BES cluster environment followed the installation manual. But we encountered some problems when we tried to add the node 2 to BES cluster. It spend a lot of time to solve these problems due to there was no any information concerning setting up node 2 in installation manual. Finally, through cooperating with EST, these problems were solved and node 2 worked successfully. So, in order to users can smoothly set up the node 2 according to the installation manual, base on our practice, we suggest the following three key points should be added to installation manual: 1. The directory "masterSourceBase" on node 1 must be shared so that it could be accessed by all nodes. For example, we shared the directory as "\BESPTSV1WIN\masterSourceBase" on windows environment, so we can set the jvm option "-Dhibernate.search.default.sourceBase" in config file "bescluster-config" as follows: -Dhibernate.search.default.sourceBase=\\BESPTSV1WIN\masterSourceBase Therefore, every node (include node 1) of BES cluster could access "masterSourceBase" through visiting sharing "\BESPTSV1WIN\masterSourceBase" 2. Add the following line to file "glassfish

a(x)\gf(x)\imq\instances esclustergf(x)\etc\passwd.txt" after the node x is deployed: jmsuser:-84a8500672a117536a62cfe428e1d6d:user:1 3. Copy file "cluster.properties" form node 1 to node x and Add the following two lines to file "glassfish

li.p: A cluster with one node/server instance is already installed.
All components are installed on one host (host1): host1: DAS, MasterIndexer, DB, node-agent1 (na1), node1/instance1 (gf1)

ol.li:
Check /etc/hosts on host1 and host2 and make sure that the host name is not mapped to a localhost address!
Use the real IP address:
##wrong## 127.0.0.2 hostname.dyn.lan.company.de hostname
##correct##10.140.16.44 hostname.dyn.lan.company.de hostname

Edit pg_hba.conf to enable the access to the database from all hosts with cluster nodes:
Add IP address of host1.
Add IP address of host2.
Restart the PostgreSQL server.

Edit postgres.conf to increase the number of maximum connections for 30 connections per additional node.
max_connections=240 #210+30.
Restart the PostgreSQL server.

If not available, create a directory on a file share (accessible by all cluster nodes) as source base of the master indexer. For example:
/mnt/user/test/cluster/masterSourceBase
On Windows create and share a folder. Map it as network drive on node machines.

section.title: Configuration and Setup for node2 on host2
section.p: The target is to have a second cluster element on a separate host (host2) including a second node agent (na2) and a second server instance (gf2).

ol.li: Install and setup Glassfish on host2 as described in the Installation Guide.

Create a node agent and a server instance on host2. For example:
asadmin create-node-agent --host host1 --port 8148 na2 asadmin create-instance --host host1 --port 8148 --nodeagent na2 --cluster bescluster gf2

Configure node2 on host2:
Copy the jmsuser entry for the IMQ broker from node1 to node2
Copy the jdbc jar <glassfish_home>/imq/lib/ext/postgresql-8.4-701.jdbc3.jar from host1 to the same location on host2
Start the node agent to create the necessary directories and files. The node agent will implicitly start the server instance.
asadmin start-node-agent na2
Stop the server instance and the node agent:
asadmin stop-instance --host host1 --port 8148 gf2 asadmin stop-node-agent na2
Copy the jmsuser entry (e.g. jmsuser:-84a8500672a117536a62cfe428e1d6d:user:1) from node1 file:
<glassfish_home>/nodeagents/na1/gf1/imq/instances/besclustergf1/etc/passwd
and paste the jmsuser entry to the same file on node2: file:
<glassfish_home>/nodeagents/na2/gf2/imq/instances/besclustergf2/etc/passwd
Add broker ID and cluster URL to the broker configuration properties:
Edit <glassfish_home>/nodeagents/na2/gf2/imq/instances/besclustergf2/props/config.properties.
Add the following properties:
imq.brokerid=brokerid_gf2 imq.instanceconfig.version=300 imq.cluster.url=file\:<glassfish_home>/nodeagents/na2/gf2/config/cluster.properties
On Windows the last property will be:
imq.cluster.url=file\:/<glassfish_home>/nodeagents/na2/gf2/config/cluster.properties
The cluster URL points to the cluster.properties file. Any change of the cluster.properties file requires a restart of all node agents with synchronization of the instances.
Execute the following command:
asadmin start-node-agent --syncinstances=true na2
All Glassfish properties (cluster- or instance-specific, e.g. ports) can be configured via the Glassfish administration console on host1).
